column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Four more Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Friday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column5: 481 cases recorded on Thursday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.A total of 280.974 cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in Northern Ireland since the pandemic began.On Friday there were 380 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals in Northern Ireland
column7: up from 378 on Thursday.There are currently 43 Covid patients in intensive care units
column8: up from 41 on Thursday.Last updated 5 November at 14:30 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 2
column10: 819 vaccines for Covid-19 have been administered in Northern Ireland as of Friday.Last updated 5 November at 14:30 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandThe total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
